summary: This document is an email chain from September 2021 between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel and a contractor, discussing logistical details for sending discovery materials (hard drives and discs) to Ghislaine Maxwell while she is incarcerated at MDC. The emails also involve communication with Maxwell's defense counsel from Cohen & Gresser regarding the exchange of evidence.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The incarcerated defendant who is to receive discovery materials (hard drives and discs) at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser representing Ghislaine Maxwell, emailing the prosecution about sending discovery materials and inquiring about hard drive specifications for 3500 material.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Defense attorney from Cohen & Gresser copied on the email from Christian Everdell regarding discovery logistics.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Defense attorney from Cohen & Gresser copied on the email from Christian Everdell regarding discovery logistics.

persons.name: Thomas J. Powers
persons.context: Defense attorney from Cohen & Gresser copied on the email from Christian Everdell regarding discovery logistics.

events.title: Discovery Production
events.description: A production of discovery materials was made on September 13, 2021, which needed to be sent to Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Hard Drive Receipt
events.description: The prosecution's paralegals received a hard drive from defense counsel Cohen & Gresser.

events.title: Hard Drive Shipment
events.description: A hard drive was packaged and left for FedEx pickup to be sent out, likely to Ghislaine Maxwell or her defense team.

events.title: 3500 Material Deadline
events.description: The deadline for the production of 3500 material (likely Jencks Act material), with defense wanting to receive loaded hard drives on that day.

events.title: Touhy Request Made
events.description: Defense counsel made a Touhy request (a request for testimony or documents from a federal employee) on August 30, 2021, and is inquiring about its status.

locations: New York, NY 10022 (Cohen & Gresser office address: 800 Third Avenue)
keyFacts: In September 2021, there was active logistical coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office and Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team (Cohen & Gresser) to physically transfer discovery materials via hard drives and discs to Maxwell at MDC.

Defense attorney Christian Everdell was coordinating the receipt of a hard drive for a September 13 production and planning for the upcoming production of 3500 material, with a deadline of October 11, 2021.
The defense had made a Touhy request on August 30, 2021, and was following up on its status in late September.

The email chain shows the procedural and technical details involved in evidence sharing in a high-profile federal case, including burning discs, creating cover letters, and determining hard drive sizes.
Multiple attorneys from Cohen & Gresser (Everdell, Pagliuca, Menninger, Powers) were involved in the discovery logistics for Maxwell's defense.
